channel.description: Recent content in short-film on Reviews Per Minute

item.title: Blood is Thicker (2011) - 5 mins
item.description: Confusing and low-res witchy tale.

item.title: Cracked Screen: A Snapchat Story (2016) - 8 mins
item.description: Wildly effective experimentation with form and horror subgenre.

item.title: Menarca (Menarca) (2020) - 22 mins
item.description: A horrifying but slight Brazilian folk horror that holds back narrative information and allows the viewer to do the work of imagination.

item.title: Moon that cracks over the darkness of my loneliness (Luna que se quiebra sobre la tiniebla de mi soledad) (2022) - 12 mins
item.description: Forgettable vampire story with themes of screen addiction and social media use.

item.title: Sinalela (2001) - 3 mins
item.description: Charming transgender Cinderella.

item.title: Skinned (Écorchée) (2022) - 15 mins
item.description: Gorgeous stop-motion animation taking inspiration from the Brothers Quay. About interdependence, suffocating relationships, and rabbits.

item.title: Steakhouse (2021) - 10 mins
item.description: Beautifully horrifying animation about domestic abuse with Ghibliesque food animation.

item.title: The Sermon (2018) - 12 mins
item.description: Traditional dystopian English folk horror subverted as very effective queer revenge story.

item.title: The Arrival of a Train at La Ciotat Station (L'arrivée d'un train en gare de La Ciotat) (1896) - 1 min
item.description: Train!

item.title: Censoring Palestine: The Weaponisation of Anti-Semitism (2020) - 25 mins
item.description: A succinct documentary on Western liberalism’s discomfort with criticising Israel or advocating for the BDS movement and how this censure limits leftist response to Israel-Palestine.

item.title: Poison (2023) - 17 mins
item.description: Deliciously tense and delightfully staged, the uncharacteristically wobbly camerawork and rapid-pace dialogue all build tension so well.

item.title: The Cowboy and the Frenchman (1988) - 27 mins
item.description: A deeply strange kaleidoscopic caricature of the culture clash between Lynch’s deep-rooted Americanness and his Francophilia. Comes very close to the comedic tone of a proto-Twin Peaks.

item.title: The Rat Catcher (2023) - 17 mins
item.description: On paper, the most disturbing of these Anderson adaptaions of Dahl but this one didn’t quite click.

item.title: The Swan (2023) - 17 mins
item.description: A wonderful microcosm of Anderson unearthing sincerity from layers of artifice while drawing attention to the artifice.

item.title: The Wonderful Story of Henry Sugar (2023) - 42 mins
item.description: A compelling experiment in marrying Anderson and Yeoman’s aesthetic to a straight adaptation although Dahl’s original text contains several Anderson hallmarks: nested structure; quick-wittedness.

item.title: Hotel Chevalier (2007) - 13 mins
item.description: Enigmatically enticing as a little crystallisation of mid-Anderson aesthetic. Would work better standalone.

item.title: Bottle Rocket (1994) - 14 mins
item.description: This short’s conciseness and energy work better to convey the themes than the feature.

item.title: Necklace (Náhrdelnik) (2023) - 17 mins
item.description: Found footage of a Czech soap where the real story hides behind clever edits eliding dark truths.

item.title: An Exercise in Discipline: Peel (1982) - 9 mins
item.description: Vividly rendered but too brief for its delicious tension.

item.title: The Bridge (2023) - 5 mins
item.description: Charming and atmospheric local horror.

item.title: I, Martha Gowans (2023) - 14 mins
item.description: Sonic experimentation with sewing machines reveals the hidden gendered histories behind innovative clothing inventions.

item.title: 3 Dialogues About the Future (2022) - 14 mins
item.description: A reflection on how machine learning reduces the human experience to mere data points.

item.title: A.I. Poetries of Female and Non-Female Beings in Gas Stations at Night (Poezii A.I. Despre Femei și Non-Femei în Benzinării, Noptea) (2022) - 19 mins
item.description: Pixelated CCTV camera footage and predictive text poetry highlight the paucity of meaning at the heart of machine learning.

item.title: Eons (2020) - 3 mins
item.description: Flicker of humanity.

item.title: Hysteresis (2021) - 6 mins
item.description: Machine learning flourishes over human dance.

item.title: Theta (2023) - 12 mins
item.description: A car’s internal monologue reveals the emptiness of a world without meaning.

item.title: Traces of Things (2018) - 10 mins
item.description: Sepia images blur into grotesque mockery of a photographic archive.

item.title: Aphonia (Afonia) (2022) - 12 mins
item.description: Connection and community are explored through some deep performances from child actors.

item.title: backflip (2022) - 13 mins
item.description: A reflection on machine learning through the medium of backflips. Hilarious and poignant.

item.title: Bellsmyre Caledonia (2022) - 6 mins
item.description: Charming rumination on thinking under lockdown.

item.title: Corrupted (Corrupto) (2022) - 15 mins
item.description: Incredible experiment with the form of digital cinema that uses distortion to convey something important.

item.title: Ice Merchants (2022) - 14 mins
item.description: Stunning hand-drawn animation anchors this vertiginous story about life and survival on the edge.

item.title: Warsha (ورشة) (2021) - 16 mins
item.description: A beautiful film on solitude and freedom of expression. Seeking silence to be who you are.

item.title: Possibilia (2014) - 6/∞ mins
item.description: Interactive impossible loop of relationship break-up.

item.title: The Art of Skiing (1941) - 8 mins
item.description: Instructional video parodies always the best Disney cartoons.

item.title: Nice Jam (2001) - 2 mins
item.description: Jam’s nice.

item.title: The Wise Little Hen (1934) - 8 mins
item.description: Hen won’t share obvious excess with grotesque pig.
